detaileddescription.para: Sent logic 1 but monitored value is logic 0
Sent logic 0 but monitored value is logic 1

Node is synchronizing on CAN communication
Node is neither receiver nor transmitter
CAN works in internal loopback mode
CAN works in external loopback mode
Continuously count down timeout after writing to TOCV register
Count down if the TX EVT FIFO is not empty
Count down if the RX FIFO0 is not empty

simplesect.para: Users need to pay attention to the CAN Identifier settings For standard identifier, the use_ext_id should be set to 0 and the std_id should be used For extended identifier, the use_ext_id should be set to 1 and the ext_id should be used

Users need to pay attention to the CAN Identifier settings For standard identifier, the use_ext_id should be set to 0 and the std_id should be used For extended identifier, the use_ext_id should be set to 1 and the ext_id should be used

briefdescription.para: MCAN RXBUF or RXFIFO Element Configuration.

simplesect.para: This Configuration provides the full MCAN RAM configuration, this configuration is recommended only for experienced developers who is skilled at the MCAN IP

: This Configuration focuses on the minimum required information for MCAN RAM configuration The Start address of each BUF/FIFO will be automatically calculated by the MCAN Driver API This RAM configuration is recommended for the most developers
The MCAN RAM related settings are excluded

briefdescription.para: Transmit CAN message in blocking way.

simplesect.para: This API can be used to prepare the data for several CAN frames prior to transmission. After this operation, software can call mcan_send_add_request(ptr, *fifo_index) API to trigger a transmission or call mcan_send_add_requests(ptr, fifo_index_masks) to trigger several transmissions
